Experiment Method.Assay Method: Spectrophotometric Assay for Complex I Activity

Material used.Material Name: Pink1 -/- Fibroblasts, Mouse Liver, Mouse Brain, Drosophila Brain and Thorax
Material used.Description: Mitochondrial homogenates from Pink1 deficient fibroblast cell lines, mouse liver, mouse brain, and fly brain and muscle-enriched tissues were analyzed.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing PINK1 with the G309D mutation showed a severe Complex I dysfunction similar to Pink1 -/- cells.
Cells expressing PINK1 with the W437X mutation showed a severe Complex I dysfunction similar to Pink1 -/- cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the average ± SEM of at least three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Pink1 +/+ cells and wild-type human PINK1 (hPINK1 res) were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Pink1 -/- cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Complex I activity comparable to Pink1 +/+ or hPINK1 res levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in Complex I activity compared to Pink1 +/+ or hPINK1 res levels (p < 0.05).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: FM1-43 Labeling for Synaptic Vesicle Reserve Pool Mobilization

Material used.Description: Third instar larval fillets from pink1 B9 mutants and controls were used for synaptic vesicle labeling.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of human PINK1 G309D mutant did not rescue reserve pool mobilization in pink1 B9 mutants.

Biological replicates.Description: The number of animals tested is indicated in the bar graphs.

Basic positive control.Description: Control flies (w pink1 REV) and pink1 mutants expressing wild-type human PINK1 were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: pink1 B9 mutants were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Reserve pool labeling intensity comparable to control flies or rescued mutants.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in reserve pool labeling intensity compared to controls (p < 0.05).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Mitochondrial Membrane Potential Imaging (JC-1 and TMRM)

Material used.Material Name: Drosophila pink1 B9 Mutants, Pink1 -/- Fibroblasts
Material used.Description: Synaptic mitochondria of Drosophila larvae and Pink1 -/- mouse fibroblasts were labeled with JC-1 or TMRM dyes.

Readout description.Result Description: Not specifically tested for this variant in this assay.
Not specifically tested for this variant in this assay.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the average ± SEM of multiple independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Control flies (w pink1 REV) and Pink1 +/+ fibroblasts were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: pink1 B9 mutants and Pink1 -/- fibroblasts were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential comparable to control or Pink1 +/+ levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in mitochondrial membrane potential compared to controls (p < 0.05).
